attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: Make coloured (unnatural) hair and all piercings allowed in all schools
attributes.background: In most schools, unnatural hair colours and more than one piercing in each ear is not allowed because it's 'distracting'. However, its not. Students already cannot express themselves through clothing (uniform), so things like hair and piercings are the only thing left, and even that is not allowed.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair that students cannot have coloured hair and more than one piercing in each ear. In almost all cases, they get in trouble and/or suspended because it's distracting. Yet, what is more distracting? Having coloured hair and a few ear piercings? Or getting suspended from school and not receiving an education? Hair and piercings are a form of expression and creativity. School should be a place where students can freely express their personality, not forced to become someone else.

attributes.action: Dementia carers give them the recognition and specialist  title they deserve.
attributes.background: It is a requirement for all staff working within dementia to have specialised training and qualifications so I feel they should be recognised for their hard work, passion and dedication in providing high standard of care for people suffering with dementia by making it a specialised career choice
attributes.additional_details: Being a manager of a dementia care home I hear a lot of staff and others refer to the carers as ONLY A CARER I feel this is degrading and demoralising. Their are a lot of good passionate caring carers out there that are not being recognised for this only recognition is bad recognition.Dementia is becoming more progressive and affecting the younger people as well as the elderly. More and more people may be affected by this condition due to people living longer, better awareness and research

attributes.action: The taxpayer should pay for the defence of our servicemen and women in court.
attributes.background: As government employees, members of the UK's Armed Forces who fought in Iraq, Afghanistan or elsehwere whilst serving the Crown, should not have to pay for their defence in court.
attributes.additional_details: If Mr Blair's defence is going to be borne by the taxpayer then so should our servicemen and women who have fought and served on the Crown and Governments behalf.

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time. This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods.

The proposed Benefit would be funded by introducing a levy of 50% of UK Profits on companies who move their operations - in whole or in part - outside the UK.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on whether or not we want a Solent Combined Authority
attributes.background: The local authorities of these areas are proposing sweeping changes to the way local government works. This will result in the creation of a new Solent Combined Authority headed by an Elected Mayor.
attributes.additional_details:
An online consultation began on 22nd July 2016 with little account taken of the need for accessibility for those with disabilities. 
We note with concern that this consultation started during the busy summer holiday period when many people are away or otherwise occupied.This is a matter of considerable concern for residents of Portsmouth, Southampton and the IOW. It also disenfranchises many students who study in the two cities and on the island but may be away during the summer.

attributes.action: A Call to Action:  Raising Awareness of Mental Ill-health in Higher Education
attributes.background:
The government and higher education authorities must recognise and prioritise the 'student voice' in promoting mental ill-health in higher education. Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi

Please copy and paste the link below to read more.  

https://imhblog.wordpress.com/
attributes.additional_details:
There is no health without mental health (Department of Health, 2011) just as there may be no academic achievement without mental health.

Please sign the petition in support of this extremely important issue.

It is hoped that our collective signatures will prompt the government to recognise and debate the importance of actively promoting the awareness of mental ill-health in higher education.

Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi
Mental Health Nurse
PhD Student

attributes.action: Amend The Cancer Act 1939 to allow advertisement which has scientific proof
attributes.background: The Cancer Act 1939 prohibits advertisement of treatments & cures for cancer due to the large amount of false medicines being sold in the 1930's. In recent years scientific breakthroughs have created more effective treatments which doctors & the wider population are unaware of due to outdated laws.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.caymanchem.com/article/2168
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27196781
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27192495
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24974185
https://gcmaf.se/gcmaf-science/
https://immunocentre.eu/research-papers/

attributes.action: A confirmatory referendum on the UK's membership of the EU should be held.
attributes.background:
1. There was a margin of 3.8% in favour of leaving the EU.  This is within the margin of error.
2. As the first referendum is advisory, Parliament is entitled to ask the electorate to confirm its decision.  It is more democratic rather than less to ask for a confirmatory referendum.

attributes.action: Petition for the Re-Introduction of Tax Relief for All Pensions Schemes
attributes.background: In Order to help make pensions once more affordable and sustainable, re introduce tax relief on all pensions.

attributes.action: Disapprove plans to frack in North Yorkshire
attributes.background: Plans to frack just half a mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village have been approved by North Yorkshire County Council, despite 4000-strong opposition. This isn't ruling on popular opinion; instead this is elitism and these plans have to be disapproved, for the safety of the local people.
attributes.additional_details: Campaigners have reacted with fury and dismay after North Yorkshire county councillors approved plans to carry out hydraulic fracturing at Kirby Misperton, near Malton. The eleven-member Planning Committee voted 7 votes to 4 to grant planning permission to Third Energy to frack just ½ mile from the picturesque North Yorkshire village. Over 1,000 people attended an anti-fracking rally outside the meeting at County Hall on Friday 20th at Northallerton, but to no avail.

attributes.action: Stop MECCG capping Continuing Health Care in a domicile setting to save money.
attributes.background: MECCG  Cap Continuing Healthcare in a domicile setting 10% over the cost of providing the same care in a nursing-home. Terminally ill people, who want to die at home, may be forced into nursing-homes against their will or placed in a position where lack of care puts them at risk of neglect.
attributes.additional_details:
The decision was made on the preferences of 15 people responding to a Survey Monkey form.
This is against the National Framework for NHS Continuing Care; article 8 of the Human Rights Act and Section 1C of the Health and Social Care Act 2012.
Case law: Rachel Gunter V South Western Staffordshire Primary Care Trust (2005)

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including EU nationals living and working in the UK
attributes.background: 3 millions EU nationals live and work in the UK, contribute to the UK economy and social fabric, pay UK taxes. The results of the EU referendum matter a great deal to them, their (often British) spouses and children. Yet they have been effectively muzzled by voting laws. This needs to be put right.
attributes.additional_details:
A similar petition was dismissed on the following grounds: 
- "historical ties with Irish and Commonwealth citizens resident in the UK". There are also historical ties between the UK and the EU. The UK joined in 1961, 4 years after the Treaty of Rome (free movement of workers).
- "usual practice for referendums in other EU states". True - however at £1,000 the cost of applying for UK citizenship is out of line with other EU states (e.g. cost of applying for French citizenship = €55).

attributes.action: Stop MHRA Removing CBD Products From Sale! Patients Will Suffer!
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are at risk of losing the only medicine that works for them. Stop the removal of Cannabidiol (CBD) products from the UK market on November 1st.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst we welcome the move to schedule CBD as a medicine following clinical trials, it must be understood that completely removing it from the market with only 28 days notice is not sufficient time for patients to find alternative ways of maintaining their health. 

CBD is well documented through clinical research to be non-toxic and non-psychoactive and has no recorded negative side effects in humans, as well as being a powerful anti-inflammatory, anti-spasmodic and anti-epilepsy drug.

attributes.action: Make a law about the ratio of staff to residents in a care home with dementia.
attributes.background: I have seen how things are run in my mother's care home and we are neglecting these vulnerable people. There are not enough staff for the care and well being of the residents. I am one of very few relatives who visit regularly. After all most of us will end up in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
Of course the answer is that more staff are needed
At the moment there is no law regulating the ratio of staff per resident, only guidelines set out by CQC, which in essence let the care home decide the best way to manage their staff. So it’s a money issue - care homes charge between £700 to £1000 per week. My mother is self funded so we are eating our way through her savings very quickly, she has a terminal illness just like many others but her treatment is not fre

attributes.action: End the triple lock on State Pension increases that is planned until 2020
attributes.background: The triple lock on the State Pension means it will increase by 2.5%, inflation or earnings (whichever is highest) each year until 2020. As the UK has voted for Brexit, and a recession is likely, it is not fair that pensioners should be protected when those of working age are not.

attributes.action: Councils should fund garden waste collection from council tax, no extra charge
attributes.background: Councils across the UK are beginning to charge householders additional money on top of council tax to collect garden waste. Garden waste is generated by the majority of households and has always been collected alongside household waste and more recently recycling. Council tax should fund this.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument that people who live in flats shouldn't be subsidising garden waste collection for households is often put forward. But many people do not have children, but their council tax goes towards schools and other local services. It is a collective local tax to cover local services. Collection of rubbish (household and garden) is clearly a local service that most people need, so should be covered by council tax.

They are exploiting a loophole charging separately for this, and it must end.

attributes.action: Fix the age for entitlement to the state pension to 60 for both men and women
attributes.background:
With high UK unemployment this would free jobs held by people at 60 years of age and older who wish to retire and release them for the unemployed and youth of the country.
This would be funded by the reduction to the welfare budget by those who come off benefits and instead would be paying taxes.

attributes.action: Improve continuity of care for students with mental health issues
attributes.background:
One in four of us experience mental health issues in the UK each year.
With 2,266,075 students attending university in the 2014/15 academic year (Higher Education Statistics Agency), we at Hope At Hand are urging the government to not only talk about mental health, but for action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government has no current plans to improve continuity of care for students studying away form home.

Students under the care of mental health teams still face months of waiting lists. By this time students are often back home. Due to their time throughout the year being split between two locations, often students can go their entire student life without much needed mental health care.
Student suicide rates rose by 50% between 2007-11(Office for National Statistics). More needs to be done.

attributes.action: Equal voting rights for EU citizens resident in the UK - Void the referendum
attributes.background:
British citizens who lived in the EU for more than 15 years were not permitted a vote. As such parity should exist for EU citizens who have lived and contributed to British society for more than 15 years.
On these grounds the referendum to leave the EU should be re-run to allow a fair vote for all.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are currently permitted to vote in Local and European Elections regardless of how long they have been resident and paid taxes for, but have been blocked from voting in Parliamentary Elections. There are many EU citizens who have lived in the UK for longer than 15 years, as are there Briish Citizens who have lived elsewhere in the EU. Both groups were discriminated by not being allowed to vote on their future on June the 23rd 2016 in the Referendum to Remain or Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Government invokes article 50 by the end of 2016
attributes.background: As you all know the people of the UK voted to leave the EU on June 23rd 2016, the process can only begin after the Government has invoked Article 50. A few people who do not wish to accept that vote are calling for another referendum, we need to press ahead or we may cause civil unrest in the UK.

attributes.action: Make gastro pacemakers available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
People suffering from Gastroperesis are being denied a simple operation to have a pacemaker fitted in their stomachs to help with gastro emptying & therefore stop the constant nausea & vomiting. 
Thank you for your help.
attributes.additional_details: Gastroperesis is an illness where the stomach can't empty due to nerve damage. We all take it for granted that when we eat the food passes through the stomach to the intestinal tract but with Gastroperesis the food just sits fermenting in the stomach& causes extreme nausea & vomiting.

attributes.action: Support increased needs for End of Life Care in the NHS and social services
attributes.background: Macmillan have warned that funds are desperately needed from the government to support growing numbers of people needing end of life care.
attributes.additional_details:
An extra 15,000 people could be dying of cancer in 2020 in England, compared to in 2010. Macmillan said if the government does not improve support, 65,000 people dying of cancer will have experienced poor overall care in their last three months of life, over the next five years.

http://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/665169/cancer-charity-warns-money-end-of-life-care-treatment

attributes.action: Delete "journalism, art or literature" exemptions from the FOI Act
attributes.background: Schedule 1, Part VI of the Freedom Of Information Act 2000 lists a number of organisations granted special exemption, where the Act only applies to information "held for purposes other than those of journalism, art or literature". This is misused to reject ANY FOI requests they'd rather not answer.
attributes.additional_details:
They use a very loose interpretation of this exemption to support these rejections, as everything they do can be linked back to one of these three categories.

They make frequent use of the Act to interrogate other public sector organisations in their journalistic research, yet use the JAoL clause to shield themselves from similar investigation.

We therefore request that these exemptions be deleted from the FOI Act, leaving them open to the same level of scrutiny as other public bodies.

attributes.action: Following the vote to leave the EU, please form a Government of National Unity
attributes.background: Due to the significance of the decision to leave the EU and the national split in opinion. We now need a cross party group to lead the Nation and work together for the good of all. It cannot be decided by one party alone. We must work together in seizing this opportunity!

attributes.action: Make impersonation of a Paramedic a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Paramedics work hard to get their registration and lean the skills to save a life,however there is an increasing number of people impersonating paramedics. This puts patient saftey at risk and the police. At present it is not illegal to do this unlike impersonating a police officer.

attributes.action: Make education about domestic violence part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: Domestic violence is a huge hidden issue within the UK. Everyday, individuals in harmful relationships are physically and emotionally abused, which directly impacts the lives of children involved.Therefore education on this issue could provide a lifeline for those impacted, and prevent future abuse.

attributes.action: Referendums should require a two thirds majority to mandate any change
attributes.background: Without a clear majority referendums can be divisive and lead to uncertain outcomes. Any mandate for a change in a referendum should therefore require the support of at least two thirds of those voting and over 50% of those eligible to vote.
attributes.additional_details: British political parties generally require two thirds of the those voting to approve any constitutional change, as do many democratic nations.  This requirement acts a s a safeguard to ensure any change is clearly wanted and does not lead to future instability. A referendum should only be held to deal with important issues which are in themselves likely to have constitutional implications.  So it is reasonable to expect any vote for change made via a referendum to be similarly safeguarded.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals
attributes.background: In response to the latest "Brexit"referendum results, we the undersigned call upon HM Government, to reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals who have been living and working in the UK for over 6 years
attributes.additional_details:
Currently to apply for British Naturalisation we have to pay £1,236.00
plus other expenses for the  "met the knowledge of English" and "life in the UK" tests

attributes.action: Public apology of UK Government to EU immigrants
attributes.background:
We EU immigrants are hardworking people who want to contribute to the community and we refuse to be portrayed in demeaning light as scroungers. 
We come to work here and pay our taxes. We contribute a huge amount to the UK. We do pay in more than we take out.
attributes.additional_details:
We are being defined as a 'problem', or 'crisis', with bigotry being stoked up against, and as EU citizens living here being denied a voice.
Xenophobia and racism been raised by the referendum campaign which is pulling out hidden hatreds all over the country towards  EU immigrants and have a negative effect on our lives. It fuelled race-based discrimination.
We demand public apology of UK Government and recognize us as British citizens to stop a torrent of racism unleashed by EU referendum.

attributes.action: Re-open Hemel Hempstead Hospital
attributes.background: Sign to try help re open Hemel Hempstead hospital.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: The UK will not leave the single market without a further referendum.
attributes.background: Throughout the referendum campaign, the public has been promised that full access to the single market can be maintained and it was on this basis that the narrow "Leave" victory margin (52/48) was achieved. It would be catastrophic for the UK economy if this access were given up or diluted.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A34 to modern 3 lane motorway standards.
attributes.background: The A34 is a very busy dual carriageway carrying ever increasing levels of traffic between the Midlands and down to the South Coast. The road was built for a bygone era and is no longer fit for purpose. There have now been numerous fatalities and serious accidents on this road in recent times.
attributes.additional_details: With the exception of the Newbury Bypass and the improved junction with the M4, the rest of the road from the M40 all the way down to Winchester was constructed in the 1970s. Bends, gradients, junctions and sight lines are not up to modern standards. The solution would be to widen and totally reconstruct the road, realigning it where necessary. If needed, funds could be found by not spending £900+ million earmarked for making the M4 around Reading a "smart motorway". The A34 is much more urgent.

attributes.action: Harsher Laws on Animal Cruelty offences In The UK. 3 Year Minimum Sentence.
attributes.background: The animal welfare act 2006 has simply not done enough to reduce animal cruelty cases. RSPCA report many cases where horrific acts of cruelty are being met with a five year disqualification for keeping animals and a fine. Abuse that includes setting dogs on fire. The law has to change.

attributes.action: End the Breed Specific Legislation
attributes.background: BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This is a petition to end the BSL. A new law should be brought in to replace the Dangerous Dogs act to ensure responsibility for a dog’s behaviour is placed on the owner or person in charge of it.
attributes.additional_details: It is the owners responbility to control there own dog or a dog they are in charge of. Also to seek help if their dog or a dog they are in charge of shows signs of aggression or behavioural problems.

attributes.action: If you turn 18 before the end of the academic year you should be able to vote.
attributes.background: Individuals who turn 18 before the end of the academic should be able to vote. As a young person interested in politics born in August, I am extremely disappointed I am unable to vote in the upcoming elections. I am the same maturity as my fellow peers, and I am affected by the outcome equally.
attributes.additional_details: One example I find uncomfortable, is a close peer of mine turns 18 the day after the EU referendum and yet is unable to vote in a decision which is potentially life altering.

attributes.action: Parliament to make 24th June a  public bank holiday if the UK vote to leave EU
attributes.background:
If the people of the UK choose to leave the European Union on the 23rd June we request that the British Parliament mark the event / people's decision with a Public Bank Holiday to be known as Britain Independence day from Europe.
(This is about the Country being free of Europe, not race/ religion )

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to regulate Speedway Clubs and Teams
attributes.background: Currently Speedway is run by the British Speedway Promotors Association, however we feel that this body of people are not running the Speedway sport in the interest of the riders or the fans, this is because the body of people are formed by the speedway promotors who own the clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because the sport is run by people who own the clubs, decisions and rules are made individually to suit their needs, and what will make them make more money or save them loosing money. 

The pay and working conditions for riders are very poor, this is not what fans pay to see.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: No-one in the House of Lords is elected. The House of Lords should be abolished, and either replaced with a democratically elected equivalent, or not replaced at all.

attributes.action: We want to stop event organisers charging 'booking fees' added to every ticket
attributes.background: It has become normal for event organisers to charge a 'booking fee' to every transaction and usually added to the face value of every ticket. This is not a booking fee and does not reflect any cost incurred by the event organiser in selling tickets.
attributes.additional_details: Booking fees may have stemmed from third-party sales of event tickets but are now charged by event organisers themselves, as a way of hiking the face value of tickets. The event organiser does not incur any additional cost in selling tickets - this is the normal course of their business, and the equivalent of a supermarket charging a 'shopping fee.'

attributes.action: Osiointergration for NHS patients
attributes.background: Osiointergration is for a metal implant anchored in to the bone to all prosthetic limbs to be surgically attached. This will vastly improve people's lives. Current the U.K. Government will not fund this. This has to change
attributes.additional_details: Dr kang at the royal free hospital advised me the only way the operations would go ahead is by people pressuring government to allow funding for these operations. Join me in making this a reality and improving so many people's lives

attributes.action: Repeal the decision that forces hospitals to stop providing heart surgery.
attributes.background: Three hospitals in Leicester, Manchester and London have just been ordered to stop surgery on patients born with heart disorders by April 2017. This puts the lives of many patients at risk. Force our government to invest in heart units and not to abandon those, like me, with heart conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If a standard of care is deemed unsatisfactory every effort should be made to raise that standard considerably to save lives. Our government shouldn't be abandoning people with heart disorders and rejecting the phenomenal work of those doctors who strive to provide the best care for their patients. This decision will also force patients and their families to travel great and costly distances. The government is putting lives at an even greater risk by shutting down these services.

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Stop classifying cats as "property" under UK law
attributes.background: Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.
attributes.additional_details: The law for a long time has failed animals, we now need to start punishing these crimes accordingly. There is an acknowledged link between animal cruelty and violence against other humans, another reason that classifying a breathing living creature as "property" is barbaric.

attributes.action: Increase child maintenance service powers to investigate the self employed
attributes.background: Self employed people can hide earnings by dealing with cash in hand jobs and holding funds in their business accounts. By default the CMS won't investigate all associated accounts be it business or personal and often don't have the necessary powers to anyway to gather a true picture of income
attributes.additional_details: Children and full time carers are going without while irresponsible parents hide their true earnings. It should be illegal for individuals to do this and the CMS should have the powers and resource to do this from the offset for all self employed individuals. Full powers to look at recent and historic bank accounts, credit cards etc both personal and business in order to see a true account of earnings. Only then will the system be fair to struggling children and full time mothers and carers

attributes.action: Amend animal welfare act to ban the practice of giving away animals as prizes.
attributes.background:
Calling upon the ban of ALL animals given as prizes to any age not just under the age of 16. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 in England and Wales makes it an offence to give away an animal as a prize if the person can reasonably be believed to be under 16 and is not accompanied by an adult.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the case in Scotland, where under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006, it is an offence to offer or give an animal to another person as a prize (whatever their age), except where it is offered in a family context.

attributes.action: Create an awareness campaign to highlight  the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is on the increase in the UK, the biggest increase is in children, especially those under the age of 5 years old.
Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms which can lead to deadly results. A delay in diagnosis can be fatal, children are dying needlessly.
attributes.additional_details:
Type 1 diabetes is a condition which is completely mis-understood, it has nothing to do with lifestyle, which is a common misconception. It complicates even the most simplest of tasks. 
There has never been a campaign that educates parents and medical professionals in the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes. Once diagnosed, and with the correct treatment and support nothing is impossible. You only have to look at our Prime Minister. 
Education is the key.
